Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Homemade Berry Turnovers", "description": "These homemade berry turnovers use a shortcut version of traditional puff pastry dough that's often referred to as rough puff pastry. Each bite is mostly flaky dough with just a touch of berry filling. Make sure the butter is very cold before beginning the dough.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "berry turnovers, puff pastry", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-berry-turnovers-with-rough-puff-pastry-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-berry-turnovers-with-rough-puff-pastry-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-berry-turnovers-with-rough-puff-pastry-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/homemade-berry-turnovers-with-rough-puff-pastry.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 teaspoon cornstarch", "1 teaspoon warm water", "1 cup (about 150g) mixed berries (I use 1/2 cup blueberries, 1/4 cup halved blackberries, 1/4 cup chopped strawberries)", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons (18g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon lemon juice", "1 and 1/3 cups (166g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for generously flouring hands, surface, and dough", "1 teaspoon granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, very cold and cubed", "6-8 Tablespoons (90-120ml) ice cold water", "1\u00a0large\u00a0egg*", "2 Tablespoons (30ml)\u00a0milk", "optional: coarse sugar for topping", "optional: vanilla icing"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cornstarch and water together until all the cornstarch has dissolved. (I just use a fork to mix\u2013very easy.) Place the berries, sugar, cornstarch mixture, and lemon juice into a small saucepan over medium heat. Using a wooden spoon or rubber spatula, stir the mixture as it cooks. Break up some of the berries as you stir. Bring it to a simmer and allow to simmer for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove pan from the heat and cool completely. The mixture will thicken as it cools. Once cool, filling can be covered and refrigerated for up to 5 days before using. Makes 3/4 cup of filling.", "name": "Make the filling first so it has time to cool", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, sugar, and salt together in a large bowl. Place the cold and cubed butter on top. Gently toss the flour and butter together with your hands, and then briefly rub the butter into the flour to begin combining them, as you can see in the video tutorial below. You do not want to break down the butter too much in this step. This step is only possible if the butter is very cold because if the butter is warm, you&#8217;ll end up with paste. I do not recommend a food processor, pastry cutter, or mixer for this step because it will break down the butter too much.", "name": "Make the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "At this point, the butter is still in large cubes/chunks. Begin adding the ice cold water 1 Tablespoon (15ml) at a time until dough forms 1 large shaggy clump in your bowl. Use your hands to toss the mixture together after you add each Tablespoon. (I usually start with 2 Tablespoons (30ml) of water before I begin tossing together.) You can use a spatula or spoon for tossing, but I really do recommend your hands so you get a good feel of the dough. As the dough begins to hydrate after about 4 Tablespoons (60ml) of water, you can start lightly squeezing or clumping the dough together with your hands to help bring it together. Mixture will still be very shaggy, as you can see in the video and photos below. If your dough feels sticky and wet before adding 6 Tablespoons of water, your butter was likely too warm\u2014you can continue with the recipe, but the dough will not be as flaky.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the shaggy clump of dough out onto a lightly floured work surface. There will still be large chunks of butter at this point and that&#8217;s a good thing. Begin patting the dough down with lightly floured hands until it&#8217;s 3/4 &#8211; 1 inch thick, about a 5&#215;8 inch rectangle. Fold the dough into thirds as if you were folding a business letter. Use your hands to gently flatten and smooth out any cracks in your dough. Wrap it up tightly in plastic wrap, parchment paper, or aluminum foil, or place into any tightly sealed container.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate dough for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours.", "name": "1st refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator to begin the \u201crolling and folding\u201d process. If the dough chilled for longer than about 3 hours, it&#8217;s likely very stiff so let it rest for about 5 minutes before you begin rolling. Lightly flour a work surface. The dough gets sticky, so make sure you have more flour nearby as you roll and fold. Use your hands to gently flatten the dough into a small square. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 6 inch wide and 12 inch tall rectangle that&#8217;s 1/2 inch thick. The exact dimensions are not important, but the thickness is. As you roll, it&#8217;s best to flip the dough over once or twice to make sure it&#8217;s not sticking to your work surface. Lightly flour your work surface as needed. Fold the rectangle into thirds as if it were a business letter. (See photos and video tutorial.) Turn it clockwise or counter clockwise and roll it out into a 6&#215;12 inch 1/2 inch thick rectangle again. Then, fold into thirds again. Turn it clockwise or counter clockwise. You\u2019ll repeat rolling and folding 4 more times for a total of 6 times.", "name": "Roll &amp; Fold", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap up/seal tightly and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes and up to 24 hours. You can also freeze the dough at this point. See freezing instructions.", "name": "2nd Refrigeration", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Rimmed baking sheets are best because butter may leak from the dough as it bakes. If you don\u2019t have rimmed baking sheets, when it\u2019s time to preheat the oven, place another baking sheet on the oven rack below to catch any butter that may drip.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator to begin the shaping steps. Lightly flour a work surface. Using a rolling pin, roll dough into a 12-inch square. Using a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut into 9 4-inch squares. Transfer squares to prepared baking sheets. (4 on one, 5 on the other.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon 1 heaping Tablespoon of filling into the center of each square. Fold one corner over the filling to make a triangle. If some chunky filling has seeped out, use a fork to push it back in if you can. Using a fork, crimp the edges of the turnovers together to seal. If the dough has become too warm and sticky to crimp, refrigerate the triangles for 10 minutes. You want to make sure you have a tightly sealed turnover to help prevent filling from spilling out in the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Chill the shaped turnovers in the refrigerator, covered or uncovered, for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour (or freeze, see freezing instructions below). You can preheat the oven and make the egg wash (next steps) as they finish up chilling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-14"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the egg and milk together. Brush on each turnover. Cut 3 slits into the tops of each to allow steam to escape. If desired, sprinkle with coarse sugar.", "name": "Egg Wash", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 22-25 minutes or until golden brown on top and around the edges. Some butter may leak from the dough, that\u2019s completely normal and expected. Feel free to remove the baking sheets from the oven halfway through baking and brush the dough with any of the leaking butter, then place back in the oven to finish baking. (That\u2019s what I do!)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-15"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove baked turnovers from the oven. Cool for at least 5 minutes before icing/serving. Centers will be hot.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-16"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle with vanilla icing\u00a0if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-16"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover iced or un-iced turnovers and store at room temperature for 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Or you can freeze them for up to 3 months. Thaw before serving. Before enjoying, feel free to reheat leftover iced or un-iced turnovers in the microwave for a few seconds until warmed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/berry-turnovers/#instruction-step-17"}], "prepTime": "PT3H30M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT4H", "recipeYield": ["9", "9 turnovers"], "recipeCategory": "Pastries", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "202", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Homemade Berry Turnovers | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "These homemade berry turnovers use a shortcut version of traditional puff pastry dough that\u2019s often referred to as rough puff pastry. Store the assembled stuffing in the refrigerator for up to 3 days ahead of time, or freeze for up to 2 months. Bring to room temperature and then bake.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/make-ahead-cornbread-stuffing/#faq-question-1731946623968", "position": 2, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/make-ahead-cornbread-stuffing/#faq-question-1731946623968", "name": "Can I use store-bought cornbread in cornbread stuffing?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, absolutely. Add the brown sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) On medium-high speed, beat in the egg and vanilla until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the hot water/molasses, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Avoid over-mixing. Give it a whisk by hand at the end to make sure there are no large lumps (a few small lumps are OK). A few larger pieces of nuts is OK. Pour into a medium bowl and stir in the sugar. Add the melted butter and stir until combined. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 9-inch pie dish. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom and up the sides to make a compact crust. Do not pack down with heavy force because that makes the crust too hard. Simply pat down until the mixture is no longer crumby/crumbly.\u00a0Tips:\u00a0You can use a small flat-bottomed measuring cup to help press down the bottom crust and smooth out the surface, but do not pack down too hard. And run a spoon around the bottom \u201ccorner\u201d where the edge and bottom meet to help make a rounded crust\u2060\u2014this helps prevent the crust from falling apart. For more shaping technique tips, see the\u00a0graham cracker crust\u00a0recipe page.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-lemon-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pre-bake crust for 8 minutes. Pour into warm crust.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/creamy-lemon-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the pie for 19\u201321 minutes or until only *slightly* jiggly in the center. You want it mostly set. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely on a wire rack. I don't recommend any ingredient substitutions other than those listed in the recipe &amp; recipe notes.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pumpkin oatmeal bars", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/healthy-pumpkin-oatmeal-bars-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/healthy-pumpkin-oatmeal-bars-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/healthy-pumpkin-oatmeal-bars-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/healthy-pumpkin-oatmeal-bars.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-chocolate-chip-oatmeal-bars/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups (255g) old-fashioned whole rolled oats\u00a0or\u00a0quick oats (not instant)*", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon store-bought or homemade pumpkin pie spice*", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (226g) fresh or canned\u00a0pumpkin puree", "1/3 cup (80g)\u00a0unsweetened applesauce*", "1/3 cup (70g) coconut oil, melted", "1/3 cup (80ml) pure maple syrup", "1/4 cup (45g) coconut sugar (or packed light or dark brown sugar)", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3/4 cup (135g) semi-sweet chocolate chips, plus a few to press into the top"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). (For whole oats, about 10 pulses. For quick oats, about 5-6 pulses.) Pour into a large bowl and add the remaining ingredients. With a rubber spatula or large spoon, stir together until combined. Mixture/dough will be very heavy and thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pumpkin-chocolate-chip-oatmeal-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Dot a few chocolate chips into the top\u2014this is optional and only for looks! Bake and cool the pie completely, and then top with even more salted caramel sauce.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "salted caramel apple pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/salted-caramel-apple-pie-slice-ice-cream-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/salted-caramel-apple-pie-slice-ice-cream-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/salted-caramel-apple-pie-slice-ice-cream-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/salted-caramel-apple-pie-slice-ice-cream.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["Homemade Pie Crust\u00a0or\u00a0All Butter Pie Crust\u00a0(both recipes make 2 crusts, 1 for bottom and 1 for top)", "1 cup (290g) salted caramel sauce, divided (I recommend my homemade salted caramel)", "10 cups (1250g) 1/4-inch-thick apple slices (about 8 large peeled and cored apples)*", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) fresh lemon juice", "1/4 cup (31g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "1/4 teaspoon ground allspice OR ground cloves (either is fine)", "1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg", "egg wash: 1 large egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon (15ml) milk", "optional: coarse sugar for sprinkling on crust"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare either pie crust recipe through step 5. The pie dough needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before using.", "name": "The crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you are not using store-bought salted caramel sauce, make the homemade version. You&#8217;ll want to make it now so it can cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, stir the apple slices, sugar, lemon juice, flour, cinnamon, allspice/cloves, and nutmeg together until thoroughly combined. Set aside.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the discs of chilled dough (keep the other one in the refrigerator). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish that&#8217;s 1.5 to 2 inches deep. Tuck the dough in with your fingers, making sure it is smooth.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the filling into the crust. It will seem like a lot of apples; that&#8217;s ok. Pile them high, and tightly together. Drizzle evenly with 1/2 cup (145g) of the caramel sauce. It&#8217;s ok if the caramel sauce is still a little warm. (If homemade salted caramel has solidified, warm it on the stove or in the microwave until it&#8217;s pourable.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the other disc of chilled pie dough from the refrigerator. Roll the dough into a circle that is 12 to 14 inches diameter. Using a pastry wheel, sharp knife, or pizza cutter, cut strips of dough; in the pictured pie, I cut 18 1/2-inch to 3/4-inch wide strips. Carefully thread the strips over and under one another, pulling back strips as necessary to weave. (Here&#8217;s a lattice pie crust tutorial if you need visuals.) Use a small paring knife or kitchen shears to trim off excess dough. Fold the overhang back towards the center of the pie, and pinch the edges to adhere the top and bottom crusts together. Crimp or flute the pie crust edges to seal.", "name": "Finish assembling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a pastry brush, lightly brush the top and edges of the pie crust with egg wash. Sprinkle the top with coarse sugar, if using. Place the pie in the refrigerator for 20\u201330 minutes while your oven preheats.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the pie onto a large baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes. Then, keeping the pie in the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Place a pie crust shield (see Note for homemade shield) on the edges to prevent them from over-browning. Continue baking the pie until the caramel apple filling is bubbling around the edges, 35\u201340 more minutes. This sounds like a long time, but under-baking the pie means an unfinished filling with firm apples with paste-like flour. If you want to be precise, the internal temperature of the filling taken with an instant read thermometer should be around 200\u00b0F (93\u00b0C) when done. Tip: If needed towards the end of bake time, remove the pie crust shield and tent an entire piece of foil on top of the pie if the top looks like it&#8217;s getting too brown.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-caramel-apple-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove pie from the oven, place on a cooling rack, and cool for at least 3 hours before slicing and serving. Filling will be too juicy if the pie is warm when you slice it. There are options for the baking pan. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat, use a seasoned 10-12 inch cast iron skillet, or grease a 9-10 inch cake pan or pie dish. Set aside. Feel free to pre-heat the skillet in the oven too, though that&#8217;s not necessary.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-yeast-bread/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, salt, and baking soda together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-yeast-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the melted butter and honey/sugar together. Pour into the flour mixture and toss to combine. (The mixture won&#8217;t fully combine yet since there&#8217;s so little wet ingredients and so much flour.) In 2-3 additions, pour in the buttermilk mixing for 15-20 seconds after each addition. After all of the buttermilk has been added, mix gently to form a shaggy, stiff, and slightly moist dough. If you used honey, there could be little specks of honey/butter in spots. That&#8217;s ok! Those will be extra flavorful specks in your bread.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-yeast-bread/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the shaggy dough and any flour crumbles that haven&#8217;t been incorporated onto a lightly floured work surface. With floured hands, work the dough into a ball and flatten into a (approximately) 7-8 inch disc as best you can (make it about 2 inches tall). If the dough is too sticky, add a little more flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-yeast-bread/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the disc to the prepared skillet/pan. Brush the whole loaf with 1 Tablespoon buttermilk. Using a very sharp knife, score a 3/4 inch deep X into the top. (Without scoring, the bread can&#8217;t bake properly in the center.) Sprinkle optional oats and/or coarse sea salt or flaky sea salt on top of the loaf.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/no-yeast-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the bread is golden brown and center appears cooked through, about 45 minutes. For best taste, though, let the bread cool for at least 30 minutes before slicing and serving. If you made a plain loaf, the slices are delicious spread with honey butter or your desired spreads. Be sure to refrigerate the rolled-out dough for at least 3 hours.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon shortbread cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/lemon-shortbread-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/lemon-shortbread-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/lemon-shortbread-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/lemon-shortbread-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2/3 cup\u00a0(135g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "2 Tablespoons fresh lemon zest", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g)\u00a0unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) fresh lemon juice", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/3 cup (40g) cornstarch\u00a0", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "optional (if not icing cookies): coarse sparkling sugar, for sprinkling", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar, sifted", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) fresh lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) milk (any kind), heavy cream, or half-and-half", "1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional: fresh lemon zest for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the sugar and lemon zest in a small food processor, and pulse several times (about 12\u201315 times) until the sugar is moistened and lemon zest is finely chopped. This step is imperative and should not be skipped.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the lemon sugar and butter together on high speed until creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the lemon juice and vanilla, and beat until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the flour, cornstarch, and salt and beat on low speed for 1 minute as the mixture begins to combine. Turn the mixer up to medium speed and beat until the dough clumps together, about 1\u20133 minutes. The dough will be thick yet soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dust a piece of parchment paper or silicone baking mat generously with flour. Using a floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to about 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. Use more flour if the dough seems too sticky. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly thick. Transfer the rolled-out dough (still on the parchment/baking mat) to a baking sheet. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a cookie cutter, cut the dough into shapes. Re-roll the dough scraps and continue cutting until all is used. *Work quickly. If the dough sits out for too long and the cookies feel room-temperature or soft to the touch, refrigerate the shaped cookies for 15 minutes before baking.* If desired, use a fork to gently poke holes in the tops of the cookies (don&#8217;t push all the way through). If using (instead of icing), lightly sprinkle coarse sparkling sugar on top of the cookies. It won&#8217;t stick at first, but it will as the cookies bake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 14\u201315 minutes, until the edges are set and just starting to turn golden. If your cookies are cut smaller than 2 inches, keep an eye on them after the 10-minute mark. If your cookies are larger than 2 inches, they may take longer to bake. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, whisk the confectioners\u2019 sugar, lemon juice, milk/cream, and vanilla together until smooth. Dip the tops of the cooled cookies in the icing, and let any excess drip off over the bowl before placing the cookies on a cooling rack or baking sheet to dry. Feel free to top each with fresh lemon zest while icing is still wet. The icing sets after about 1 to 2 hours, so you can easily store, stack, and transport the cookies.", "name": "For the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Enjoy cookies right away or wait until the icing sets to serve them. Once the icing has set, these cookies can be stacked. Cover and store iced cookies at room temperature for up to 3 days, or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Cover and store plain cookies at room temperature for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-shortbread-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT3H30M", "cookTime": "PT14M", "totalTime": "PT3H45M", "recipeYield": ["36", "36-38 2.25-inch cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "31", "ratingValue": "4.5"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Lemon Shortbread Cookies.mov", "description": "These mega flavorful iced lemon shortbread cookies strike a wonderful balance of crumbly, crunchy, soft, and tender.", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/NT7bsHmd.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/NT7bsHmd-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2025-09-17T12:58:28+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Alycia"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-05", "reviewBody": "Delicious! Lightly grease four 6-ounce ramekins with butter or nonstick spray. See recipe note about other ramekin sizes. Place in a baking pan or small casserole dish. Four 6-ounce ramekins fit nicely into a 9-inch square bake pan. The pies will bake in a water bath inside the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/upside-down-key-lime-pies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the egg yolks on medium-high high speed until pale and slightly thickened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the lime juice, sweetened condensed milk, and lime zest. Beat on medium speed until combined. You&#8217;ll have about 2 cups of filling. Pour evenly into prepared ramekins.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/upside-down-key-lime-pies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Without splashing into the ramekins, slowly pour hot water into the casserole dish around the ramekins, about halfway up the sides of the ramekins.\u00a0If it\u2019s easier, you can transfer the casserole dish to the oven first, then carefully pour in the hot water.", "name": "Add water for water bath", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/upside-down-key-lime-pies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully place the casserole dish/baking pan in the oven. Bake until the top of each is mostly set, about 17-20 minutes. When lightly tapped, the very center should only slightly jiggle. Though not necessary, you can also check the internal temperature. These are safe to eat when an instant read thermometer reads 160\u00b0F (71\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/upside-down-key-lime-pies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using tongs or an oven mitt, remove the pies from the water bath and place on a wire rack set over a baking sheet or kitchen towel to catch any dripping water. Cool pies for about 1 hour at room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour before assembling and serving. You can enjoy at room temperature, but they taste better if you chill in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/upside-down-key-lime-pies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "As the pies cool, crush up the graham crackers with your hands or place in a zipped-top bag and crush with a rolling pin. Impress your guests when you reveal the beauty inside this impressive cake!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "checkerboard cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/how-to-make-checkerboard-cake-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/how-to-make-checkerboard-cake-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/how-to-make-checkerboard-cake-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/how-to-make-checkerboard-cake-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 and 3/4 cups (443g) sifted all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "2 teaspoons baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 and 1/2 cups (340g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (400g) granulated sugar", "5 large eggs, at room temperature", "3 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 and 3/4 cups (420ml) buttermilk, at room temperature*", "1/3 cup (50g) rainbow sprinkles (plus more for garnish)", "2-3 drops teal food coloring (or any color)", "1 and 3/4 cups (396g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "7 cups (840g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "6 Tablespoons (90ml) heavy cream", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/4 teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease four 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy\u2014about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 5 full minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. On medium-high speed, add 1 whole egg at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix this batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "There will be 8 cups of batter total\u2014transfer half of it to another bowl. Stir in 1/3 cup sprinkles into half and the food coloring into the other half. Pour/spread batter evenly into prepared cake pans.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for around 25 minutes or until the cakes are baked through.\u00a0To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it is done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use the video above for a visual of this step. Using a 6-inch round cookie cutter (it&#8217;s large!), cut a circle into each cooled cake. Using a 3-inch round cookie cutter, cut a circle out of the 6-inch circle. You will have 4 3-inch circles, 4 6-inch circles (the outlines), and 4 9-inch circles (which are just a thin outline of cake since the centers are missing).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand-held mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy\u2014about 2 minutes. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and salt with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting is too thin, more cream if frosting is too thick, or a pinch more of salt if frosting is way too sweet.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Again, use the video above for a visual of this step. Place one blue 9-inch outline of cake onto a serving plate, cake stand, or cake turntable. Fill with a funfetti 6-inch circle, then a blue circle. Spread frosting evenly on top. Repeat with next layer: 9-inch funfetti filled with 6-inch blue then 3-inch funfetti. Spread frosting evenly on top. Repeat next 2 layers. Spread the remaining frosting all over the top and sides. Decorate top and sides of cake with extra sprinkles, if desired.", "name": "Assemble the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/checkerboard-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the cake for at least an hour before slicing and serving. You should have about 2 cups (packed) crumbs, or 250g. Pour crumbs into a large bowl. Add the melted butter and stir to combine. The mixture will be thick and quite wet. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into prepared pan. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom to make a compact, thick crust. Bake for 10 minutes, and then cool for 10 minutes before spreading the filling on top. Made with fresh orange zest and a simple two-ingredient ganache, they\u2019re elegant, make-ahead friendly, and even better the next day as the flavors meld and the cookies soften. Have extra flour handy for rolling out the dough.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate orange cookie sandwiches", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (120g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons fresh orange zest (about 1 large orange)", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 large egg yolk, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed for rolling", "optional: coarse sparkling sugar for topping", "2/3 cup (160g/ml) heavy cream", "6 ounces (170g) semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The chocolate ganache needs at least 45 minutes to thicken before it can be used in the cookie sandwiches. I recommend starting the ganache while the cookies are in the oven.", "name": "Preliminary note", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the cookies: In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium-high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners\u2019 sugar and orange zest, and beat until completely combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the egg, egg yolk, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Finally, add the flour and beat on low speed until incorporated, then gradually increase the speed until the dough comes together. The cookie dough will be very, very soft.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Generously flour a rolling pin. Roll out the dough onto a very generously floured sheet of parchment paper or a silicone baking mat (I prefer the silicone mat) to about 1/4-inch thickness. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly 1/4-inch thick. (If it helps, place a piece of parchment on top of the dough before you roll it out, to keep the rolling pin from sticking to the dough.) Sprinkle with more flour as needed to prevent sticking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the rolled-out dough, with the parchment or mat underneath, onto a baking sheet and refrigerate for at least 3 hours and up to 2 days. If chilling longer than a couple hours, lightly cover with parchment paper or plastic wrap.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Using a 1.5-inch round cookie cutter, cut into shapes. I used the 1.5 inch fluted round cookie cutter from this set. Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used. Arrange cookies on baking sheets 2 inches apart. If desired, sprinkle and lightly press some coarse sugar into the tops.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake cookies for 9\u201311 minutes until very lightly browned around the edges. The cookies do not brown much on top. Rotate the baking sheets halfway through bake time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before filling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the ganache: Place chopped chocolate in a heat-safe bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate and let it sit for 2\u20133 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. Slowly stir until chocolate is completely melted and combined with the cream. Allow to cool and thicken until it&#8217;s a pipeable/spreadable consistency, at least 45 minutes, or up to 1.5 hours (depending on the temperature of your kitchen).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fit a piping bag with a large round tip, such as Wilton #12. (You can spread the ganache on with a knife if you don&#8217;t want to use a piping tip, but it can get pretty messy!) Fill the piping bag with the thickened ganache. Flip half of the cookies over and pipe a dollop of ganache onto the flat side. Top with the remaining cookies and gently press until the ganache spreads to the edges.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-orange-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Store cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": Pour the warm milk into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment (OR you can use a handheld mixer). With a spoon, manually stir in the sugar and yeast. Cover the bowl with a towel and let sit until the yeast is foamy, about 5-10 minutes. If the yeast does not dissolve and foam, start over with fresh yeast. On low speed, beat in the softened butter until it is slightly broken up. Add the eggs, one at a time, and then the salt. The butter won\u2019t really be mixing into the mixture, so don\u2019t be alarmed if it stays in pieces. On low speed, gradually add the flour. Once it is all added, beat on medium speed until a soft dough forms\u2014about 4 minutes.", "name": "Make the dough:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Increase speed to medium-high and beat until the dough is soft and supple, about 6 minutes longer. If you do not have a stand-mixer with a hook attachment, knead the dough by hand in this step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form the dough into a ball and transfer it to a lightly greased bowl. Cover the dough loosely with plastic wrap, a paper towel, or aluminum foil and let sit in a warm place until doubled in size, about 2 hours. Here\u2019s what I do: turn the oven on to 200\u00b0F (93\u00b0C). Turn the oven off. Stick the covered dough inside the oven and allow it to rise in this warm environment.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Warm the strawberries in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly for 4 minutes until the strawberries begin to release juices. Add the granulated sugar and cornstarch and continue to stir for another 2 minutes. The mixture will thicken. Remove from the heat, spoon into a heatproof bowl or container, and chill until ready to use. You do not want a warm filling as you spread it onto the dough.", "name": "As the dough rises, make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease the bottom of a 9\u00d713-inch baking dish, then line with parchment paper. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and, using a rolling pin, roll into a 12\u00d718 inch rectangle. Make sure the dough is smooth and evenly thick, even at the corners.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the strawberry filling all over the dough. Tightly roll up the dough to form an 18-inch-long log. Cut into 12 even rolls (about 1.5 inches in width each). Arrange them in the prepared baking pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the rolls and allow to rise in a warm environment once again until the are puffy\u2014about 1 \u2013 2 hours (or overnight, see Overnight instructions.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After the rolls have risen, preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Bake for about 25 minutes, until they are golden brown. About halfway through the bake time, I like to cover the rolls loosely with aluminum foil so the tops don\u2019t brown too much. Remove pan from the oven and allow to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes as you make the glaze.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-rolls-with-sweet-lemon-glaze/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the lemon juice and confectioners\u2019 sugar together until smooth. Perfect for any day requiring celebration.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "funfetti cheesecake, sprinkle cheesecake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Funfetti-Cheesecake-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Funfetti-Cheesecake-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Funfetti-Cheesecake-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Funfetti-Cheesecake-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (180g) graham cracker crumbs (about 12 full sheet graham crackers)", "5 Tablespoons (71g) unsalted butter, melted", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "24 ounces (678g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1 cup (240g) full-fat sour cream (or plain yogurt), at room temperature", "1 Tablespoon pure vanilla extract (yes, Tablespoon!)", "1/4 teaspoon almond extract*", "3 large eggs, at room temperature", "3/4\u20131 cup rainbow sprinkles*", "optional: additional sprinkles and whipped cream for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust oven rack to the lower third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Spray a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Review these handy graham cracker crust tips before you get started. If you&#8217;re starting out with full-sheet graham crackers, you can use a food processor or blender to grind them up. Or crush them in a zipped top bag with a rolling pin. Mix the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and granulated sugar together with a rubber spatula in a medium bowl until combined. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Press into a 9-inch springform pan and halfway up the sides. Make sure the crust is very compact and tight. It will be thick. Wrap aluminum foil on the bottom and tightly around the outside walls of the springform pan, which is how to prep the pan for the water bath in step 4. Bake the crust for 10 minutes. Allow to slightly cool as you prepare the filling.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl\u2014about 3 full minutes until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the sour cream, vanilla, and almond extract and beat until combined. On low speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until just blended. Do not over-mix the filling after you have added the eggs. Very gently fold in the sprinkles, being careful as they may bleed their color a little. I usually start with 3/4 cup and add a little more (around 1/4 cup) if I think the batter could use a little extra.\u00a0", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If needed for extra visuals, see my How to Make a Cheesecake Water Bath; the visual guide will assist you in this step. Boil a pot of water. You need 1 inch of water in your roasting pan for the water bath, so make sure you boil enough. I use an entire kettle of hot water. Place the pan inside of a large roasting pan. Pour the cheesecake batter on top of the crust. Use a rubber spatula or spoon to smooth it into an even layer. Carefully pour the hot water inside of the pan and place in the oven. (Or you can place the roasting pan in the oven first, then pour the hot water in. Whichever is easier for you.)", "name": "Prepare the simple water bath (see note)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 50\u201360 minutes or until the center is almost set.* Turn the oven off and open the door slightly. Let the cheesecake sit in the oven for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely to room temperature.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight (preferred). Loosen the cheesecake from the rim of the pan and remove the rim. Cut into slices and serve chilled. Top with additional sprinkles and whipped cream, if desired.\u00a0Cover leftover cheesecake and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/funfetti-cheesecake/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT45M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT24H", "recipeYield": ["12", "serves 12"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "9", "ratingValue": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Francine"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-21", "reviewBody": "I made this cheesecake for my family2 week ago, they love it I\u2019m making another one today. I\u2019m giving four stars because, for me, the filling was much looser than I would like in a whoopie pie. I filled them and had to refrigerate them immediately, and even doing that, some of the cookies had slipped slightly while they were chilling. I would definitely make these again, but I\u2019d replace the filling with the cream cheese one that I use for my pumpkin whoopie pies, as it is much more stable."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "JH"}, "datePublished": "2025-04-13", "reviewBody": "These baked up beautifully! Was told they were delicious!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rena"}, "datePublished": "2025-05-07", "reviewBody": "I just made these for teacher appreciation week\u2026 I k ow some teachers who are going to be so excited! This cookie dough\u00a0must be chilled, so plan accordingly.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate cherry blossom cookies, chocolate cherry shortbread", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Chocolate-Cherry-Blossoms-by-sallysbakingaddiction.com-my-favorite-shortbread-cookie-flavored-with-cherry-and-almond-and-adorned-with-chocolate-kisses-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Chocolate-Cherry-Blossoms-by-sallysbakingaddiction.com-my-favorite-shortbread-cookie-flavored-with-cherry-and-almond-and-adorned-with-chocolate-kisses-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Chocolate-Cherry-Blossoms-by-sallysbakingaddiction.com-my-favorite-shortbread-cookie-flavored-with-cherry-and-almond-and-adorned-with-chocolate-kisses-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Chocolate-Cherry-Blossoms-by-sallysbakingaddiction.com-my-favorite-shortbread-cookie-flavored-with-cherry-and-almond-and-adorned-with-chocolate-kisses-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2/3 cup (134g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) maraschino cherry juice", "2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "16 maraschino cherries (drained and chopped)", "24 Hershey&#8217;s Kisses, unwrapped", "4 ounces semi-sweet\u00a0chocolate\u00a0(optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, make sure you have enough room in the freezer/refrigerator because you&#8217;ll need to quickly chill the baked cookies with the Hershey&#8217;s Kiss on top in step 4.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until creamy, about 1 minute. Switch mixer to medium speed and add the the sugar, vanilla and almond extracts.\u00a0Scrape down the sides and the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on high, slowly drizzle in 1 Tablespoon of the cherry juice. Beat for 1 minute on high. Turn the mixer off and pour the flour into the wet ingredients.\u00a0Turn the mixer on low and slowly beat until a very soft dough is formed, then, with the mixer still running on low, add the chopped cherries. Beat just until the cherries are disbursed in the dough. Press the dough down to compact it\u00a0and tightly cover with plastic wrap to chill until firm, at least 4 hours (and up to 3 days). If the cookie dough is not sufficiently chilled, your cookies will spread all over the cookie sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350F degrees. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats (silicone mats preferred to reduce spreading). Shape the cookie dough into balls. Mine were about 1 Tablespoon of dough per ball. Make sure they&#8217;re nice and smooth. If you find that the balls of dough are sticky and/or have gotten a little soft after rolling, place the balls of dough back into the refrigerator to firm up. You absolutely DO NOT want soft dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 11-12\u00a0minutes, or until very lightly browned on the edges. The cookies will puff up and spread slightly. Do not overbake. In fact, I only baked mine for 10\u00a0minutes. I prefer them a little soft. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes then gently press a Hershey&#8217;s Kiss into each cookie and quickly stick the baking sheet in the freezer or fridge so the warm cookie does not completely melt the chocolate. Let the Hershey&#8217;s Kiss set on the cookies in the freezer/refrigerator for about 15 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the freezer/refrigerator, then drizzle with chocolate: melt the chocolate in a double boiler or in the microwave, in 20 second increments, stirring after each increment until melted. I used a plastic condiment bottle to drizzle the melted chocolate\u00a0chocolate; a fork or spoon work too.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cherry-blossom-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT4H15M", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT5H15M", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "3", "ratingValue": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Erin"}, "datePublished": "2022-08-06", "reviewBody": "Delicious! Rich chocolate ganache is swirled with creamy pistachio ice cream, and it\u2019s ready to eat after about 8 hours of freezing.\u00a0", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate swirl pistachio ice cream", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/no-churn-pistachio-ice-cream-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/no-churn-pistachio-ice-cream-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/no-churn-pistachio-ice-cream-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/no-churn-pistachio-ice-cream.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/", "recipeIngredient": ["6 Tablespoons (90g/ml) heavy cream", "1/2 cup (90g) quality chocolate chips (such as Guittard)*", "1 and 1/4 cups (163g) shelled roasted pistachios (salted or unsalted)*", "2 cups (420g/ml) heavy cream, cold", "14-ounce (396g) can full-fat sweetened condensed milk\u00a0", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste", "1/4 teaspoon almond extract", "optional: tiny drop green gel food coloring*", "2 Tablespoons roughly chopped pistachios", "2 Tablespoons roughly chopped chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place chocolate chips in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate, then let it sit for 2\u20133 minutes to gently soften the chocolate.", "name": "Make the chocolate ganache", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a metal spoon or small silicone spatula, very slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. If it&#8217;s not melting, do not microwave it. See Troubleshooting Chocolate Ganache in this post on How to Make Chocolate Ganache. Set the ganache aside at room temperature to slightly cool and thicken while you make the pistachio ice cream base.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a food processor, pulse or process the pistachios until they are finely ground. Set aside.", "name": "Make the pistachio ice cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream on medium-high speed until stiff peaks form, about 4 minutes. Add the pistachios, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, almond extract, and green gel food coloring (if using), then beat on low speed until just combined.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon/spread about half (just eyeball it) of the ice cream mixture into a deep freezer-safe container or bowl. I suggest a 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan. Drop spoonfuls of about half of the chocolate ganache on top. Spoon/spread remaining ice cream mixture on top, followed by remaining ganache. With a knife, gently swirl the ganache and ice cream together. Top with chopped pistachios and chocolate chips, if desired. Cover tightly and freeze for at least 8 hours and up to 2 weeks.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop, serve, and enjoy!", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "", "totalTime": "PT8H20M", "recipeYield": ["1", "1.5 quarts"], "recipeCategory": "Ice Cream", "cookingMethod": "Freezing", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "16", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Chocolate Swirl Pistachio Ice Cream | Sally's Baking", "description": "Chocolate swirl pistachio ice cream will become your new favorite summer dessert. Make a 2-ingredient chocolate ganache and swirl it with a creamy, salty-sweet pistachio ice cream base. It\u2019s ready to eat after 8 hours of freezing.\n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-swirl-pistachio-ice-cream/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #chocolateswirlpistachioicecream #homemadeicecream #homemadeicecreamrecipe #nochurnicecream #pistachioicecream \n\n\u2022 More of Sally's baking recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT2M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/5ZSmGpephac?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ZSmGpephac", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5ZSmGpephac/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2025-06-20T13:15:03+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rae"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-08", "reviewBody": "This was the first time I\u2019d come across a no churn, no egg ice cream recipe and I knew it would be the start of a lot of experimentation. \r\n\r\nThe flavour of this recipe is phenomenal. I could not find almond extract where I live, but did find pistachio, go figure, and the resulting flavour of my ice cream was spot on the premium gelato I pay through the nose for.\r\n\r\nBefore trying this recipe, I looked at several others and often saw a reference to a \u201ccan\u201d of sweetened condensed milk without saying the amount, so I appreciate that this recipe gave the weight needed because our cans in Mexico are a little smaller. So I got 600g pourable pouch of La Lechera that could be resealed and returned to the fridge for a future batch!.\r\n\r\nSalted pistachios are definitely the way to go as the milk was very sweet. I used a whole bag of Wonderful brand shelled and salted pistachios, which was the recipe amount plus enough to sprinkle on top. I just did regular ol\u2019 Hershey chocolate chips for my ganache, and they melted beautifully, with the climate for once working in my favour, the ganache staying smooth and pourable while I assembled the ice cream. Instead of doing the stovetop method, I heated the cream for one minute in the microwave then stirred in the chocolate chips.\r\n\r\nCream doesn\u2019t whip where I live unless you have a climate controlled kitchen, so my based was very runny, but the end result still had a texture very closed to churned ice cream. I was very surprised. I did use a shallow cake pan rather than a loaf pan as I worried that it wouldn't freeze all the way through otherwise. So this is a very forgiving and easy recipe!\r\n\r\nI have a deep freezer that I keep much colder than the kitchen freezer, so six hours was plenty of freezing time. I know I\u2019m going to be making this ice cream base again a lot with other ingredient combinations, even if I never get the dang cream to whip!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jenny"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-19", "reviewBody": "Wow! Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-moist-chocolate-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, espresso powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, granulated sugar, brown sugar, oil, and vanilla together until completely smooth. Pour half of the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Then half of the buttermilk. Gently whisk for a few seconds. Repeat with the remaining wet ingredients and buttermilk. Stir until *just* combined; do not overmix. The batter will be thin.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-moist-chocolate-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour or spoon the batter into the liners. 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 Tablespoon vegetable oil, avocado oil, or olive oil", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) packed\u00a0light or dark brown sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract or raspberry liqueur (such as Chambord)", "1 and 1/2 cups (188g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "2/3 cup (56g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "1/3 cup (100g) raspberry preserves", "3/4 cup (90g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/2 cup (13g) freeze-dried raspberries"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, oil, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg and vanilla extract, and beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "name": "Make the cookie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-raspberry-crinkles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together until combined. Pour into the wet ingredients, and add the raspberry preserves. Beat everything on low speed until combined. The cookie dough will be thick and very sticky. Cover dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this sticky cookie dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-raspberry-crinkles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes. If the cookie dough chilled longer than 3 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes. This makes the chilled cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-raspberry-crinkles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Sift through a fine-mesh sieve to separate out the seeds. Discard the seeds and place the raspberry powder into a small bowl. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar and mix together.", "name": "Make the topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-raspberry-crinkles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop and roll dough into balls, about 1.5 Tablespoons (35g) of dough each. A medium cookie scoop is helpful here. Roll each ball very generously in the raspberry-sugar topping. Place 3 inches apart on the baking sheets.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-raspberry-crinkles/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 12\u201314 minutes or until the edges appear set and the centers still look soft. Using a pastry cutter (love this one) or a couple forks, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse pea-sized crumbs. Add the water and stir until the flour is moistened. Add 1 more Tablespoon of water if the dough seems dry. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and, using your hands, work the dough into a ball. Flatten it into a thick disk.
