The dough mixes up in one bowl, chills into neat logs, and bakes into buttery cookies with soft centers and crisp edges. Perfect for gifting, holidays, or make-ahead baking!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "slice and bake cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/slice-and-bake-cookies-flavors-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/slice-and-bake-cookies-flavors-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/slice-and-bake-cookies-flavors-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/slice-and-bake-cookies-flavors.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 cups + 2 Tablespoons (267g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "Add-ins &amp; toppings\u00a0(see Notes for full flavor measurements)", "coarse sugar for rolling, such as this sparkling sugar"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until combined and creamy, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Beat in the egg and vanilla extract on high speed. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed, and continue to beat until fully combined. Add the flour and salt and beat on low speed until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Finally, beat in the chosen flavor add-ins (see Notes) on low speed until just combined. Avoid overmixing\u2014blend only until the mix-ins are evenly distributed. The cookie dough will be thick and slightly sticky. If it seems too sticky to roll into logs, beat in 1\u20132 Tbsp more flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the dough out onto a floured work surface and, with floured hands, divide or cut in half. Roll/shape each half into an 8-inch log, about 1.5 to 2 inches in diameter. The measurements don&#8217;t have to be exact. Tightly wrap the dough logs in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours and up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour enough coarse sugar on an 8-inch or larger plate to cover it. Roll the logs in the sugar. You may need to really press the dough logs down into the sugar if it&#8217;s not really sticking. (I find coating the dough logs in sugar after chilling much easier, as the dough is too sticky to neatly roll in sugar right after mixing.)", "name": "Optional rolling in sugar", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice each dough log into 12 equally thick cookies and arrange cookies on prepared baking sheets about 2 inches apart.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 13\u201315 minutes or until very lightly brown around the edges (they won&#8217;t brown much). Remove from the oven and allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/slice-and-bake-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dip or drizzle with melted chocolate and add toppings, if desired. Add them straight from the freezer. No need to thaw. The crumble may need an extra 5\u201310 minutes in the oven since frozen fruit releases more moisture. I don't recommend using frozen pears AND frozen berries, as that will throw off the bake time and finished texture.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pear-berry-crumble/#faq-question-1762941589456", "position": 3, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pear-berry-crumble/#faq-question-1762941589456", "name": "Can I swap both the pears and berries?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Definitely. This base formula works with many different fruits. We use strawberry rhubarb in <em><a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/sallys-baking-101/\">Sally's Baking 101</a></em>. Or you can try apples instead of pears, cranberries instead of blackberries, or peaches and strawberries instead pears and berries. You can use any combo as long as the volume of fruit stays the same (roughly 6\u20137 cups total). Play around with the spices. Place the topping in the freezer while you continue.", "name": "Make the topping first", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pear-berry-crumble/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, gently stir together all of the filling ingredients. Around the 30-minute mark, loosely cover with aluminum foil, to prevent the topping from over-browning. Remove from the oven, place on a cooling rack, and allow to cool for at least 20 minutes. The filling will continue to set as it cools. leveled)", "3/4 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3 large egg whites, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract*", "optional: seeds scraped from 1/2 of a vanilla bean", "1/2 cup (120g) full-fat sour cream*", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk*", "about 1/4 cup your favorite jelly (any flavor!)", "5 Tablespoons (71g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (250g) creamy peanut butter", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/3 cup (80ml) heavy cream", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "\u00bc\u00a0teaspoon salt", "optional: crushed peanuts for topping"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0Line a 12-count muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2 liners\u2014this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-jelly-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.", "name": "Make\u00a0the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-jelly-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy\u2014about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Add the egg whites, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean (if using). Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. Do not overmix. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-jelly-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter into the liners\u2014fill only 2/3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. Bake for 19-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For around 30 mini cupcakes,\u00a0bake for about 11-13\u00a0minutes, same oven temperature.\u00a0Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before filling and frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peanut-butter-jelly-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a sharp knife, cut a circle/hole into the center of the cupcake to create a little pocket about 3/4 inch deep. Add the peanut butter and beat on medium-high speed until the two are combined. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar,\u00a0cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on low speed for about 20 seconds, then gradually increase to high speed.\u00a0Beat on high for 1\u00a0minute. Frost the cupcakes. This helps guarantee the tart will hold its shape and prevents the frangipane from leaking out.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (188g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for work surface", "2 Tablespoons (25g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "1/4 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) cold\u00a0unsalted butter, cubed*", "1/4 cup\u00a0(60ml)\u00a0ice cold water*", "egg wash: 1 large egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon (15ml) milk", "optional: sliced almonds and coarse sugar", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (50g) almond flour or almond meal", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3 heaping cups peach slices (about 2-3 medium peaches)*", "1 cup (140g) blueberries*", "1 Tablespoon granulated sugar", "1 Tablespoon almond flour, almond meal, or all-purpose flour"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Whisk the flour, sugar, and salt together in a medium bowl. Using a pastry cutter (love this one) or a couple forks, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse pea-sized crumbs. Add the water and stir until the flour is moistened. Add 1 more Tablespoon of water if the dough seems dry. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and, using your hands, work the dough into a ball. Flatten it into a thick disk. Wrap the dough disk in plastic wrap and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour and up to 3 days (or freeze up to 3 months).", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#zlrecipe-instruction-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the frangipane ingredients in a medium bowl on medium-high speed until combined and creamy. Cover and refrigerate until step 6.", "name": "As the dough chills, prepare the frangipane", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently toss the blueberry peach filling ingredients together in a medium bowl until all the fruit is coated with almond flour and sugar. Cover and refrigerate until step 6.", "name": "Prepare the blueberry peach filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (190\u00b0C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a lightly floured work surface, roll the dough into a 12-inch circle. If desired, trim the rim of the circle to make a clean edge. Transfer dough to the prepared baking sheet. (You can also roll the dough right out onto the parchment paper or silicone baking mat that you are using to line the baking pan. If doing so, lightly flour the parchment paper or silicone baking mat. This is what I usually do.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Evenly spread the frangipane into the center of the dough, leaving a 3 inch edge. Spoon or arrange the peaches and blueberries on top of the frangipane. Leave any fruit juices that are at the bottom of the bowl\u2014that could make the galette filling too soggy. Gently fold the edges of the dough over the filling, overlapping the dough as necessary. Press gently to seal the edges. Brush the crust edges with egg wash and sprinkle the crust with sliced almonds and coarse sugar, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the shaped galette for at least 20 minutes and up to 8 hours. If refrigerating for longer than 1-2 hours, cover it lightly.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-peach-frangipane-galette/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the filling is bubbly and the crust is golden brown, about 35-38 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before slicing and serving. Now it&#8217;s time to layer the ingredients in\u00a032-ounce mason jars. I suggest layering the dry ingredients into the jars in a thoughtful way so each layer stands out. Dark (cocoa powder), light (granulated sugar), dark (brown sugar), light (flour + baking soda + salt), dark (chocolate chips), then the peppermint bark or M&amp;Ms. Use a spoon to layer or, if you&#8217;re particular like I am, use a funnel\u00a0so the layers are extra neat. Don&#8217;t worry if the egg isn&#8217;t fully combining with the butter; it&#8217;ll all come together with the dry ingredients. Add all of the jar ingredients and mix on low speed until combined. Cookie dough does NOT require chilling. Drop by rounded Tablespoonfuls onto parchment paper or silicone baking mat lined baking sheets, about 3 inches apart. Bake in a\u00a0350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) oven\u00a0for about 10 minutes until the edges are set. Each recipe yields about 2 dozen cookies.\u00a0Cookies stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 3 months. Cookie dough balls freeze well for up to 3 months. The tangy cream cheese frosting puts them over the top!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "red velvet cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Red-Velvet-Cupcakes-6-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Red-Velvet-Cupcakes-6-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Red-Velvet-Cupcakes-6-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Red-Velvet-Cupcakes-6.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 large eggs, room temperature and separated", "1 and 1/3 cups (166g) all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (32g) cornstarch*", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "4 teaspoons (7g) natural unsweetened cocoa powder", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (120ml) canola or vegetable oil", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon distilled white vinegar", "liquid or gel red food coloring*", "1/2 cup (120ml) buttermilk, room temperature*", "cream cheese frosting for topping"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0Line a\u00a012-count muffin pan\u00a0with cupcake liners. This recipe makes 14 cupcakes, so you will have 2\u00a0cupcakes to bake in a 2nd\u00a0batch.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat 2 egg whites on high speed in a medium bowl until soft peaks form, about 2-3 minutes. See photo at the bottom of this yellow cupcakes with milk chocolate frosting post for a visual. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift the flour and cornstarch together to make sure it is evenly combined. Whisk this, along with baking soda, cocoa powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy\u2014about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the oil and beat on high for 2 minutes. The butter may look &#8220;piece-y&#8221; and not completely combine with the oil. This is normal and ok.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 2 egg yolks and the vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Beat in the vinegar and the food coloring, until you reach your desired color. I use 2 Tablespoons. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix. Fold whipped egg whites into cupcake batter with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. The batter will be silky and slightly thick. (If there are still pieces of butter\u2014and there were in 1 test batch for me\u2014again, this is ok. They will melt inside as the cupcakes bake, making them even more buttery.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/red-velvet-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon batter into cupcake liners filling 1/2 &#8211; 2/3 of the way full.\u00a0Bake for 20-21 minutes or until the tops of the cupcakes spring back\u00a0when gently touched\u00a0and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Don&#8217;t overbake;\u00a0your\u00a0cupcakes will dry out. High end bakery worthy.  The process is a little fiddly.   I used a hand held mixer and high end european butter.  Its a small amount of batter so the hand held mixer worked great.  I think you would lose a lot of batter and control with the stand  mixer.   I got a wonderful emulsion of butter, sugar and oil by adding just a little oil first which beat in beautifully, then added the rest of the oil.  So no butter was visible.  I put in the 1 tsp vinegar suggested here. I used the milk plus vinegar instead of buttermilk.  I'm sure buttermilk would be a better taste but no one had anything but praise for the end result with milk.   This is a really great cupcake.  I think the irish butter helped the frosting too.  I added the 1 TBS corn starch to the frosting - why wouldn't you want it stiffer?  It was easy to pipe and hold a pyramid shape. The cupcakes are fairly easy and most time will be spent on the caramel frosting. A candy thermometer guarantees success in step 5.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "apple spice cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/salted-caramel-frosting-on-apple-spice-cupcake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/salted-caramel-frosting-on-apple-spice-cupcake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/salted-caramel-frosting-on-apple-spice-cupcake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/salted-caramel-frosting-on-apple-spice-cupcake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (188g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "2/3 cup (135g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/3 cup (65g) granulated sugar", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (80ml) milk,* at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 large apple, peeled and finely chopped (about 1 and 1/2 cups, or 180g)*", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, cut into 4 equal pieces", "1 cup (200g)\u00a0packed light or dark brown sugar (I like to use 1/2 cup of each)", "5 Tablespoons heavy cream, divided*", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2 cups (240g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "optional garnish: salted caramel sauce\u00a0and apple slices"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2 liners\u2014this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar together in a medium bowl until combined. Whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract, then whisk in the milk. Slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir gently until combined. The batter will have a few lumps. Fold in the apples.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 of the way full with batter. Bake for 21\u201323 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through baking. A toothpick inserted in the center will come out clean when done. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(This frosting is popular, so we have a separate salted caramel frosting post if you need more help making it.) Combine the butter and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. With a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir constantly as the butter melts. Once butter has melted, switch to a whisk to make sure the two are really combined. (Otherwise, you might see an oily layer around the edges where they\u2019re still a bit separated; you do not want that.)\u00a0Once melted butter and brown sugar are combined, add 3 Tablespoons of heavy cream and the salt. Whisk to combine, then stop whisking and attach a candy thermometer to your pan, making sure the bulb is not touching the bottom of the pan.\u00a0Let the caramel boil, giving it a quick whisk every 30 seconds or so, until the temperature reaches 230\u00b0F (110\u00b0C). On my stove, it takes just under 2 minutes.", "name": "Start the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the saucepan from heat, give it another quick whisk, and let cool for a minute. Carefully transfer the salted caramel to a heat-proof mixing bowl set on a cooling rack and cool for just 15\u201320 minutes before continuing. The caramel sauce thickens during this time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift in confectioners\u2019 sugar and add remaining 2 Tablespoons of heavy cream. With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat on medium-low speed until the ingredients are incorporated. Turn mixer up to high speed and beat for 1 minute. Avoid over-mixing or the frosting will begin to &#8220;break&#8221; and separate. Let it sit for at least 20\u201330 minutes before filling your piping bag, to give it a chance to thicken up to a pipeable consistency.", "name": "Finish the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes and drizzle with salted caramel, if desired. I used Wilton 2A piping tip on the pictured cupcakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cupcakes at room temperature for up to 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. I\u00a0recommend a cupcake carrier for storing and transporting decorated cupcakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-spice-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT22M", "totalTime": "PT4H", "recipeYield": ["14", "14-15 cupcakes"], "recipeCategory": "Cupcakes", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "40", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Apple Cupcakes with Salted Caramel Frosting | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "Soft, buttery, and spiced apple cupcakes come together with a quick and easy batter. One incredible dessert that you'll want to make again and again!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "fudge brownie cupcakes, fudge brownie cupcakes with cookie dough frosting", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/brownie-cookie-dough-cupcakes-2-22-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/brownie-cookie-dough-cupcakes-2-22-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/brownie-cookie-dough-cupcakes-2-22-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/brownie-cookie-dough-cupcakes-2-22.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fudge-brownie-cupcakes-with-cookie-dough-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 ounces unsweetened or bittersweet chocolate, chopped\u00a0(I used Ghirardelli)", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, cut into cubes", "1 and 1/4 cups (250g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "3 large eggs", "3/4 cup (94g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) packed light brown sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 cup + 2 Tablespoons (140g) heat-treated all-purpose flour*\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1/4 cup (60ml) milk*", "1 cup (180g) mini chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C). Line a 12-count muffin pan with cupcake liners or spray with nonstick spray. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fudge-brownie-cupcakes-with-cookie-dough-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the chopped chocolate and sliced butter together in the microwave in 30 second increments, stirring after each until completely smooth and combined. Allow to cool for a few minutes. Stir in sugar, then vanilla. Add in eggs, 1 at a time, mixing well after each addition. Mix in the flour and salt.", "name": "Make the brownie cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fudge-brownie-cupcakes-with-cookie-dough-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour batter into 12 muffin tins and bake for 20-23 minutes. Mine took 22 minutes. A toothpick inserted in the center will have moist crumbs. Be careful not to overbake the cupcakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fudge-brownie-cupcakes-with-cookie-dough-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the cupcakes are cooling in the pan, make the frosting. With an electric handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream together the butter and sugar at medium speed. Add the vanilla and beat well. Stir in the flour and salt until doughy. Stir in the milk and beat until fluffy. Gently fold in chocolate chips. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment beat the butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and orange zest together until creamed, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the eggs, sour cream, and vanilla and beat on medium speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. The mixture will look curdled; that&#8217;s ok\u2014it will come together when you add the dry ingredients.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, add the milk and fresh orange juice, and beat on medium speed it all until the batter is completely combined. Batter is thick, yet silky.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix the 2/3 cup (135g) brown sugar and cinnamon together.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour half of the cake batter evenly into the prepared Bundt pan. Sprinkle the swirl ingredients evenly on top, doing your best to avoid sprinkling near the edges. Keep the cinnamon sugar in the center, so it doesn&#8217;t bake/get stuck onto the pan, which makes inverting the cake difficult. Cover evenly with remaining cake batter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for\u00a055-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean with just a couple lightly moist crumbs. This is a large, heavy cake so don&#8217;t be alarmed if it takes a little longer in your oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-orange-bundt-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once done, remove from the oven and allow to cool for just 1 hour inside the pan. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Turn the mixer up to medium-high speed and beat until the dough comes together. If the dough is too crumbly and won&#8217;t come together after a couple minutes of beating, stop the mixer, pour the dough crumbles on a work surface, and use your hands to bring it together. (I often have to do this, so don&#8217;t worry.) You can also try sprinkling the dough with a few drops of water and then beat again; or get your hands wet, then press the dough clumps together tightly until it forms one large clump of thick dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-shortbread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With lightly floured hands, divide the dough in two. (If you want to be precise, the dough should weigh about 650g, so each half will be about 325g.) Roll and shape each piece of dough into an 8-inch log.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-shortbread/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour coarse sugar onto a large plate. "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/#/schema/logo/image/"}}, {"@type": "Person", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/#/schema/person/3744271f85efc7e271411c4968f1c4ba", "name": "Sally McKenney", Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Cinnamon Roll Wreath", "description": "Learn how to make a warm and fluffy, ooey gooey cinnamon roll wreath!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cinnamon roll wreath, cinnamon rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/cinnamon-roll-wreath-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/cinnamon-roll-wreath-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/cinnamon-roll-wreath-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/cinnamon-roll-wreath.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (240ml) whole milk", "2/3 cup (135g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 tablespoons Platinum Yeast from Red Star instant yeast\u00a0(2 standard size packets)", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature and cut into 4 pieces", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "4 and 1/2 cups (563g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for hands/work surface", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons ground cinnamon", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) milk"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat milk to about 95\u00b0F (35\u00b0C) using a microwave or stovetop. Pour the warm milk into the bowl of a stand electric mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment (OR you can use a handheld mixer OR no mixer, but a stand mixer is ideal). With a whisk, manually whisk in the sugar and yeast. Cover with a towel and let sit until the yeast is foamy, about 5-10 minutes. If the yeast does not dissolve and foam, start over with fresh active yeast. On low speed, beat in the softened butter until it is slightly broken up. Next add the eggs, one at a time, and then the salt. The butter won&#8217;t really be mixing into the mixture, so don&#8217;t be alarmed if it stays in pieces. On low speed, gradually add the flour. Once it is all added, beat on medium speed until a soft dough forms. Increase speed to medium-high and beat until the dough is soft and supple, about 6 minutes longer. *If you do not have a stand-mixer with a hook attachment, knead the dough by hand in this step.", "name": "Make the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "dough: Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form the dough into a ball and transfer it to a lightly greased bowl. Cover the dough loosely with plastic wrap, a paper towel, or aluminum foil and let sit in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 to 2 hours. Here&#8217;s what I do:\u00a0turn the oven on to\u00a0200\u00b0F (93\u00b0C). Once heated to that temperature, turn the oven off. Stick the covered dough inside the oven and allow it to rise in this warm environment.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Lightly flour the parchment paper. Place the dough on top and, with floured hands, pat down to roughly form a 10&#215;20-inch rectangle. Make sure the dough is smooth and evenly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the softened butter all over the dough. In a small bowl, toss the cinnamon and sugar together until combined and then sprinkle evenly over the dough. Tightly roll up the dough to form a 20-inch long log. Cut into 20 1-inch rolls, only slicing 3/4 of the way through so they are still connected at the bottom. Use kitchen shears if you need to.", "name": "For the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn one of the end cinnamon rolls on its side. Turn the next one so that it slightly overlaps the first. Repeat with each roll, forming into a circle and overlapping each. Again,\u00a0kitchen shears help to cut any dough as you&#8217;re shaping.", "name": "Shape the wreath", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place a ramekin in the middle of the wreath. This will help it hold its shape.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the wreath loosely with plastic wrap and slide a baking sheet underneath the whole thing. Use a large one with no edges\u00a0so it can slide under easily.\u00a0Allow to rise again in a warm environment until puffy, about 45 minutes &#8211; 1 hour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-roll-wreath/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). The flavor, and moist, slightly chewie texture and moist, slightly chewie texture from the chips and coconut made them a hit.\r\n\r\nWill definitely make them again."}], "datePublished": "2012-04-06", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/take-2-funfetti-cake-batter-blondies/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/take-2-funfetti-cake-batter-blondies/#article"}, "mainEntityOfPage": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/take-2-funfetti-cake-batter-blondies/"}]}, {"@context": "https://slickstream.com", "@graph": [{"@type": "Plugin", "version": "3.0.1"}, {"@type": "Site", "name": "Sally&#039;s Baking", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com", "description": "Trusted Recipes from a Self-Taught Baker", "atomUrl": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/feed/atom/", "rtl": false}, {"@type": "WebPage", "@id": 2449, "isFront": false, "isHome": false, "isCategory": false, "isTag": false, "isSingular": true, "date": "2012-04-06T06:00:00-04:00", "modified": "2022-04-03T06:40:38-04:00", "title": "Cake Batter Blondies", "pageType": "post", "postType": "post", "featured_image": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Cake-Batter-Blondies-21.jpg", "author": "Sally McKenney", "categories": [{"@id": 5, "parent": 710, "slug": "brownies-bars", "name": "Brownies &amp  Bars", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 710, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Desserts"}]}, {"@id": 710, "parent": 0, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Desserts", "parents": []}, {"@id": 851, "parent": 720, "slug": "nut-free", "name": "Nut Free", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 720, "slug": "special-diet", "name": "Special Diet"}]}], "tags": ["cake batter", "cake mix", "eggs", "milk", "oil", "sprinkles", "white chocolate", "white chocolate chips"]}]}]

Add the brown sugar and granulated sugar and beat on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in egg, egg yolk, and vanilla on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Beat in 1/4 cup (74g) of Nutella until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/nutella-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the\u00a0flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt together in a large bowl. On low speed, slowly mix into the wet ingredients until combined. Add 1 cup (180g) of\u00a0chocolate chips and\u00a0mix on low for about 5-10 seconds until evenly disbursed. Turn the mixer off and add the remaining Nutella. Beat for 5-10 seconds\u00a0so the Nutella streaks through the cookie dough and is not fully mixed. Dough will be a little crumbly, that is OK. Dough will be extremely crumbly if the remaining Nutella was mixed in too much.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/nutella-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop and roll balls of dough, about 1 Tablespoon of dough each, into balls. My oven has hot spots and yours may too\u2014be sure to rotate the pan once during bake time. The baked cookies will look extremely soft in the centers when you remove them from the oven.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/nutella-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheet. During this time, if the cookies are too puffy, try gently pressing down on them with the back of a spoon. They will slightly deflate as you let them cool. As the cookies cool, grab the remaining 1/4 cup of chocolate chips. Gently press a few chocolate chips into the tops of the slightly warm cookies (this is for looks and optional, of course!) and finish each with a sprinkle with sea salt. Review recipe Notes before starting.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peppermint bark, homemade peppermint bark", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/christmas-peppermint-bark-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/christmas-peppermint-bark-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/christmas-peppermint-bark-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/christmas-peppermint-bark.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-bark/", "recipeIngredient": ["12 ounces (339g) white chocolate, coarsely chopped and divided*", "6\u00a0ounces (170g)\u00a0semi-sweet or bittersweet chocolate, coarsely chopped*", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil or coconut oil, divided", "1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract, divided", "2\u20133 regular-size candy canes (24\u201336g total), crushed"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line the bottom and sides of a 8-inch or 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil, smoothing out any wrinkles. Or use a lined baking sheet. Set aside.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-bark/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bottom layer: There are a few ways you can melt the chocolate. You can use a double boiler over just barely simmering water or you can use the microwave. The microwave is a little more convenient for most, so my directions are for a microwave. (If using a double boiler, follow this recipe, but melt the chocolate layers in your double boiler over simmering water.) Place 6 ounces of white chocolate in a small heatproof bowl or a liquid measuring cup. Add 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Melt in 20-second increments, stirring vigorously with a silicone spatula or spoon after each increment, until completely melted and smooth. White chocolate and chocolate overheat easily, so it&#8217;s important to do this in increments. Once melted, stir in 1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract. Pour melted white chocolate into the prepared baking pan, and, with an offset spatula or spoon, spread into a thin smooth layer. (If using a baking sheet, make it as thin as you&#8217;d like&#8230; I usually spread it out to about 8&#215;12 inches.) Place the baking pan in the refrigerator for 10\u201315 minutes or until almost completely set. If it sets completely, the bark layers could separate.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-bark/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place semi-sweet chocolate in a small heatproof bowl or a liquid measuring cup. Add 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Repeat melting, just as you did with the white chocolate in step 2. Once melted, stir in remaining 1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract. Pour all of the semi-sweet chocolate over the white chocolate layer and spread it into a smooth layer. Place the baking pan back in the refrigerator for 10\u201315 minutes or until almost completely set.", "name": "Middle layer", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-bark/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the remaining white chocolate in a small heatproof bowl or a liquid measuring cup. Add last 1/2 teaspoon of oil. Repeat melting, just as you did with the other layers. Pour over the bark layers and spread into a smooth layer. (This layer will not have peppermint extract.) Sprinkle evenly with crushed candy canes. To crush, place the unwrapped candy canes in a sealed zipped-top bag and roll or bang with a rolling pin or meat mallet until crushed.", "name": "Top layer", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-bark/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the bark until completely set, about 1 hour. If your bark chilled in the refrigerator for longer than 3\u20134 hours, let it sit at room temperature for 10\u201315 minutes to slightly soften before breaking/slicing. Slowly mix dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until no lumps remain. Batter will be thick. Do not over-mix. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-wedding-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a whisk, a handheld mixer, or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the egg whites until until thick and foamy, about 3 minutes. See photo at the bottom of my post for yellow cupcakes with milk chocolate frosting for a visual of the egg whites. With a rubber spatula, fold the whipped egg whites into the cupcake batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick. Divide batter among 12 cupcake liners and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Set it aside to cool at room temperature for 20 minutes. (Be sure the melted white chocolate has cooled for 20 minutes, so it&#8217;s still melted but not scorching hot, which would melt the butter.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-wedding-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed for 1 minute. Switch the mixer to low speed and slowly add the confectioners\u2019 sugar. Stir the cooled white chocolate so that it is smooth, and then add it to the butter/sugar mixture. Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes until combined and creamy. Add the cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat for 1 minute until combined. Taste. Add 1 more Tablespoon of heavy cream/milk if needed to thin out, if desired. For best success, review the recipe Notes before starting.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate, cake, ganache", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/1-layer-6-inch-chocolate-cake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/1-layer-6-inch-chocolate-cake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/1-layer-6-inch-chocolate-cake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/1-layer-6-inch-chocolate-cake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (63g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (21g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon espresso powder (optional)", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/4 cup (60ml) vegetable oil", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/4 cup (60ml) buttermilk, at room temperature", "one 4-ounce (113g) quality semi-sweet or bittersweet chocolate bar, finely chopped", "1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream\u00a0or\u00a0heavy whipping cream", "optional garnish: raspberries, mint, and/or sprinkles"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease a 6-inch round cake pan, line with a parchment paper round, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cake seamlessly release from the pan. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, espresso powder, and salt together in a large bowl. In a medium bowl, whisk the oil, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, and buttermilk together in a medium bowl. Pour the wet ingredients into the flour mixture and whisk until smooth and combined.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the cake batter evenly into prepared cake pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for around 27\u201330 minutes or until the cake is baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it\u2019s done. Avoid over-baking. Cake is thick and moist, so the center may slightly sink. That&#8217;s normal. Allow cake to cool in the pan set on a wire cooling rack. Cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the chocolate ganache as the cake cools because the ganache must cool too: Place chopped chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that\u2019s too hot!) Pour over chocolate, then let it sit for 2\u20133 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. With a metal spoon or small silicone spatula, very slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. Ganache will be thin, so let it cool and thicken for at least 30\u201360 minutes before using. Refrigerating speeds this up, but the ganache will not cool evenly. Stir it a few times as it sets in the refrigerator so it remains smooth. You can also let the ganache fully cool and thicken (takes about 2 hours). After 2 hours, you can whip the cooled ganache with a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment until light in color and texture, about 3\u20134 minutes on medium-high speed. (Whipped ganache can be spread or piped. It is pictured on the cupcakes in the post above. I used Wilton 1M piping tip.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/small-chocolate-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread ganache on cooled cake. If ganache has cooled and thickened enough (or if you whipped it), you could pipe it with a piping bag/tip. Decorate with optional garnishes, if desired. Set aside. In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter for 2 minutes on high speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the brown sugar and granulated sugar, then beat on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in the egg and vanilla on high speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. On low speed, slowly mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until combined then beat in the chocolate chips. The cookie dough will be thick. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture and beat only until *just* combined. In a steady stream with the mixer running on low speed, add the cooled cocoa mixture and then beat until smooth. Avoid over-mixing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cupcakes-with-mint-chocolate-chip-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide cupcake batter between muffin liners, filling each about 3/4 full.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cupcakes-with-mint-chocolate-chip-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 16\u201319 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean with no wet crumbs. (A few moist crumbs are OK.) Remove from oven and cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cupcakes-with-mint-chocolate-chip-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium-high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add 3 cups of confectioners&#8217; sugar, heavy cream, peppermint extract, and food coloring (if using). Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting is too thin (up to 4 cups) or more cream if mixture is too thick. Taste, and add salt if it&#8217;s too sweet. I usually add a pinch. You can also add more food coloring if desired, or more peppermint extract if you want a stronger mint flavor. Using a rubber spatula, fold in the chocolate chips by hand.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cupcakes-with-mint-chocolate-chip-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes. I usually pile the frosting on generously using an icing spatula. There may be leftover frosting depending how much you use on each cupcake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-cupcakes-with-mint-chocolate-chip-frosting/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve immediately or store covered at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 1 day before serving. A sprinkle of sea salt is the perfect finishing touch on each fudge-like cookie.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "dark chocolate cookies, salted chocolate cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/salted-double-dark-chocolate-cookies-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/salted-double-dark-chocolate-cookies-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/salted-double-dark-chocolate-cookies-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/salted-double-dark-chocolate-cookies-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (125g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/3 cup (27g) natural unsweetened cocoa powder*", "1/3 cup (27g) Hershey&#8217;s special dark cocoa powder*", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) milk", "1 cup (180g) semi-sweet or dark chocolate chunks and/or chips, plus a few more for topping*", "sea salt for sprinkling"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This cookie dough requires at least 3 hours of chilling, but I prefer to chill the dough overnight. The colder the dough, the thicker the cookies.", "name": "Preliminary note", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color, about 2-3 minutes. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and then beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, both cocoa powders, baking soda and salt together until combined. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly pour into the wet ingredients. Beat on low until combined. The cookie dough will be quite thick. Switch to high speed and beat in the milk, then the chocolate chips. The cookie dough will be sticky and tacky. Cover dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this sticky cookie dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes. If the cookie dough chilled longer than 3 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes. This makes the chilled cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. (Always recommended\u00a0for cookies.)\u00a0Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop and roll dough, a heaping 1.5 Tablespoons of dough each, into balls (I like to use this medium cookie scoop). To ensure a thicker cookie, make the balls taller than they are wide (almost like a cylinder or column). Arrange 2-3 inches apart on the baking sheets. Sprinkle each with sea salt. The cookie dough is certainly sticky, so wipe your hands clean after every few balls of dough you shape.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 11-12 minutes or until the edges appear set and the centers still look soft. Tip: If they aren\u2019t really spreading by minute 9, remove them from the oven and lightly bang the baking sheet on the counter 2-3x. This helps initiate that spread. Return to the oven to continue baking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool cookies for 5 minutes on the baking sheet. During this time, I like to press a few more chocolate chips into the tops of the warm cookies or sprinkle with more sea salt. (This is optional.) Transfer to cooling rack to cool completely. The cookies will slightly deflate as they cool.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover cookies tightly and store at room temperature for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/salted-dark-chocolate-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT3H15M", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT3H30M", "recipeYield": ["20", "20-22 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "18", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Mugsy"}, "datePublished": "2020-12-16", "reviewBody": "taste was great, it turned out with a wetter dough and flatter cookie, would probably add another half to whole cup of flour"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Dana"}, "datePublished": "2020-12-21", "reviewBody": "These are absolutely incredible. Add the milk and vanilla extract and mix until combined. Turn the mixer off and add the flour and salt. Mix on low speed at first, then turn the mixer up to medium speed and mix until combined. The dough will be thick and crumbly, just keep mixing until it comes together. Mix in mini chocolate chips.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cookie-dough-pretzel-bites/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the dough into balls, about 2 teaspoons of dough per sandwich. The shortening is used to thin the chocolate out. Dip the pretzel bites halfway into the melted chocolate and place bites back on baking sheet. Refrigerate the dipped bites for at least 10 minutes to allow the chocolate to set. See the recipe notes for substitutions and other ingredient suggestions.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "biscuit vegetable pot pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/vegetable-pot-pie-biscuit-topping-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/vegetable-pot-pie-biscuit-topping-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/vegetable-pot-pie-biscuit-topping-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/vegetable-pot-pie-biscuit-topping.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups\u00a0(250g)\u00a0all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus extra for hands", "1 Tablespoon\u00a0baking powder\u00a0(yes, Tablespoon!)", "1/2 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, cold and cubed", "1 cup + 2 Tablespoons (270ml) whole milk, divided", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter", "1 cup (130g) diced yellow onion\u00a0(1/2\u00a0of a large onion)", "1 cup (130g) sliced or diced carrots\u00a0(1\u20132\u00a0large carrots or a handful of baby carrots)", "1 cup (120g) sliced or diced celery\u00a0(2\u20133\u00a0stalks)", "1 cup (120g) roughly chopped\u00a0mushrooms", "3\u20134 garlic cloves, minced", "1/3 cup (42g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "1/2 teaspoon\u00a0fresh\u00a0ground pepper", "2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves (or 1 teaspoon dried)", "2 cups (480ml) vegetable broth", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk", "2 cups (about 300g or 10 ounces) mixed vegetables (such as frozen peas, frozen or fresh broccoli and/or cauliflower florets; see Note)", "2 Tablespoons chopped fresh parsley (or 2 teaspoons dried)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl or use a food processor. Add the cold butter and cut into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter or pulse several times in the processor. Cut/pulse until coarse crumbs form. Add 1 cup (240ml) milk (reserve the rest for brushing on dough in step 4), and then stir/pulse until the dough comes together. Dough will be very shaggy and a little wet. If it\u2019s too dry, fold in another Tablespoon of milk. If it&#8217;s too wet, fold in another Tablespoon of flour. With generously floured hands, shape biscuit dough into 8 or 9 1-inch-thick discs. The amount of biscuits you need (and their diameter) depends on the size and shape of the baking dish you&#8217;re using for the pot pie. Dough is sticky, so keep your hands floured. Biscuits don\u2019t have to be perfect or neat. Place shaped biscuits on a lined plate or baking pan, cover tightly, and refrigerate until ready to use in step 4, or for up to 2 days.", "name": "Make the biscuit topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a large skillet, pot, or 11- or 12-inch oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, celery, mushrooms, and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until vegetables have softened and released some liquid. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and thyme until flour has absorbed all the liquid. Stir in the broth and 1/2 cup (120ml) milk. Cook and simmer for 7\u20139 minutes or until thickened into a thick soup-like consistency. Stir in the mixed vegetables and parsley, and then remove from heat. Taste and add more salt, pepper, thyme, or parsley if desired. Cool for 5 minutes.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "As it&#8217;s cooling, preheat oven to\u00a0400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour filling into greased 2.5- or 3-quart baking dish, or use a 9-inch pie dish that&#8217;s 2 inches deep. Arrange cold biscuits on top, squeezing them in as necessary to fit. Brush the tops of the biscuits with remaining 2 Tablespoons (30ml) milk.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 25 minutes, and then, keeping the pot pie in the oven, turn oven up to 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C) and bake for 5\u20136 more minutes, or until biscuits are golden brown on top.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-vegetable-pot-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving. Whisk in the egg whites, sour cream, milk, and vanilla extract until combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-n-cream-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until the batter is completely combined. Cupcakes must be completely cooled before topping.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-n-cream-cupcakes/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream on medium-high speed until stiff peaks form, about 3\u20134 minutes. Transfer the whipped cream to a medium bowl.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-n-cream-cupcakes/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the same bowl used for the whipped cream (no need to wash it), beat the cream cheese on medium-high speed until smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla extract and beat until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the whipped cream to the cream cheese mixture and gently fold together with a spatula just until combined. Do not overmix.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-n-cream-cupcakes/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes. With the mixer running on low speed, add the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract. By far my favorite baking site. I've made dozens of these recipes, and this was one of my only disappointments. I was a little skeptical about using lime extract in the buttercream, but decided to go for it because Sally endorsed it and the reviews were so good. But, even using a little less than what the recipe called for, the buttercream tasted cloying and fake - like a can of 7Up. The cake was divine, but consider using the lime juice/zest route for the buttercream if you don't like a very sweet, very synthetic lime flavor. Or I might even fill them with lime curd and use a just use a vanilla-tequila buttercream instead of making lime buttercream. Whisk in the egg, then the egg yolk. Finally, whisk in the vanilla. The mixture will be thin. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix together with a large wooden spoon or silicone spatula. The dough will be very soft, thick, and appear greasy. Fold in the chocolate chips. The chocolate chips may not stick to the dough because of the melted butter, but do your best to combine them.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toasted-smore-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the dough and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2-3 hours or up to 3 days. Roll into a ball, making sure the shape is taller rather than wide\u2014almost like a cylinder. This helps the cookies bake up thicker. Repeat with remaining dough. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "White Chocolate Peppermint Cupcakes", "description": "White chocolate peppermint cupcakes are soft and fluffy, topped with incredible white chocolate frosting!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "White Chocolate Peppermint Cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 3/4 cups (207g) cake flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "3/4 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3 large egg whites, at room temperature", "2\u00a0teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon peppermint extract", "1/2 cup (120g) full-fat sour cream at room temperature*", "1/2 cup (120ml)\u00a0whole milk at room temperature*", "6 ounces (170g) white chocolate, coarsely chopped", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (240g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "1/4 cup (60ml) heavy cream", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract (reduce to 1/4 teaspoon for less intense flavor)", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "optional: green or red food coloring, crushed candy canes, coarse sugar sprinkles for topping"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 12-count muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2 liners\u2014this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the egg whites, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. Do not over-mix. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter into the liners\u2014fill only 2/3 full to avoid spilling over the sides when they rise. Bake for 19\u201322 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For around 30 mini cupcakes, bake for about 11\u201313 minutes, same oven temperature. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the cupcakes are nearly cool, melt the white chocolate for the frosting: Place chopped white chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl (I usually use a glass liquid measuring cup), and microwave in 20-second increments, stirring after every 20 seconds until completely smooth. Set it aside to cool at room temperature for 20 minutes. (Be sure the melted white chocolate has cooled for 20 minutes, so it&#8217;s still melted but not scorching hot, which would melt the butter.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-peppermint-cupcakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed for 1 minute. Switch the mixer to low speed and slowly add the confectioners\u2019 sugar. Stir the cooled white chocolate so that it is smooth, and then add it to the butter/sugar mixture. Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes until combined and creamy. Add the cream, vanilla extract, peppermint extract, and salt. Beat for 1 minute until combined. Taste. Add 1 more Tablespoon of heavy cream/milk if needed to thin out, if desired.
